meanings.definition: A person, especially a diplomat, invested with full power to transact business on behalf of their government.
meanings.sent1: The plenipotentiaries negotiated the peace treaty on behalf of their country.
meanings.sent2: The plenipotentiaries signed the trade agreement with full authority.
meanings.sent3: The plenipotentiaries had the power to make decisions that could change the course of history.
meanings.sent4: In the world of diplomacy, plenipotentiaries are like chess pieces moving on a global board.
meanings.sent5: The word 'plenipotentiaries' evokes images of individuals with immense diplomatic power.

meanings.definition: The full power or authority to act on behalf of another.
meanings.sent1: With plenipotentiaries, the delegation could make decisions independently.
meanings.sent2: The CEO granted her plenipotentiaries the authority to finalize the deal.
meanings.sent3: The plenipotentiaries were like superheroes with the power to make things happen.
meanings.sent4: In the business world, plenipotentiaries are the key players who drive major decisions.
meanings.sent5: The concept of plenipotentiaries embodies the idea of complete trust and empowerment.
